node.title: Two-week quarantine rules for arrivals from southern Africa to end on Wednesday
node.alt: A passenger walks next to a departures sign at Sydney International Airport
node.description: NSW Health says scrapping the rules previously impactingÂ arrivals from eight countries of concern will bring all international travellers under the same requirements.
node.content:
["Mandatory two-week quarantine rules for all international arrivals from eight southern African countries of concern will end at 6am on Wednesday.", "NSW Health announced late on Tuesday night the measures put in place to stem the seeding of the COVID-19 Omicron variant would cease from 6am on December 15.", "Instead fully-vaccinated people arriving from\u00a0South Africa, Lethoso, Zimbabwe,\u00a0Botswana, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Namibia, Eswatini and\u00a0Malawi must self-isolate for 72 hours and can leave\u00a0after\u00a0receiving\u00a0a negative test.", "They must also\u00a0avoid high-risk settings for 12 days.", "People who have previously arrived from those countries and were in hotel quarantine must remain there for another 72\u00a0hours, NSW Health said.", "Unvaccinated travellers would still be required to enter quarantine for 14 days.", "It brings all international arrivals into the state under the same testing and isolation requirements.", "People flying into NSW from the eight nations\u00a0were previously ordered into 14-days of isolation under rules introduced in late November.", "The measures were put in place soon after Omircon was detected in South Africa and declared a new variant of concern by the World Health Organisation.", "On Tuesday NSW recorded 804 COVID-19 cases, the most seen in the state for 10 weeks.", "Chief Health Officer Kerry Chant encouraged all international arrivals to get tested after 12 days of arrival.", "\"With the festive season upon us and people starting to gather in larger numbers, I urge everyone to maintain their vigilance and to continue to come forward for testing with even the slightest symptoms and to follow the public health advice,\" Dr Chant said.", "So far 85\u00a0cases of the Omircon variant have been identified in NSW, with some\u00a0believed to have contributed to a series of large clusters seeded at pubs and nightclubs.", "One outbreak stemming from a Newcastle nightclub on December 8 has led to more than 200 infections, including confirmed cases of the Omicron strain.", "Hefty penalties remain in place for people who breach isolation laws on arrival from overseas, including fines of $5,000\u00a0for individuals and $10,000 for corporations.", "The relaxation of rules affecting travellers from the eight African countries coincides with the winding back of restrictions on unvaccinated NSW residents from Wednesday.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
